description.narrative: - Improving access to quantity and quality water supply (mostly rainwater) and sanitation infrastructures, ground water recharge, improving personal hygiene, and improving domestic/ environmental sanitation situation particularly focusing children, women, poor, marginalised, community in remote area. - Enhancing cso's and local government bodies to manage, operate and maintain wash schemes in a sustainable way. - Advocacy/influencing at local level - Develop entrepreneurship skills

Along with environmental sanitation the program also aims at addressing issues on climate change. Besides this the RAIN programs aims at conducting multiple Use system (MUS) activities such as use of waste water, slurry of biogas for productive purposes.

BSP Nepal has proposed WASH projects to RAIN Foundation & SIMAVI including ground water recharge, spring protection/improvements, small gravity flow water supply schemes and other multiple use of rainwater to support the livelihood of the community people, in two water catchment areas of Salyan district. In Salyan one catchment fully and partly covers the 5 VDCs (Korbang Jhimpe, Triveni, Sinbang & Rim) of constituency no. 2 of Salyan district. This Catchment has five small sub catchments namely Lankinikhola, Sallekhola, Luhamkhola, Tunibot Khola and Ghurkhola. The other catchment belongs to constituency numbers 1 & 2 of the Salyan district, it covers the 6 VDCs (Kupindedha, Majhkanda, Nigalchula, Ghajaripipal, Mulkhola and Devasthal VDCs) partly and fully .The areas have been identified in close coordination with DDC, DWSS sub division office, WASH actors and community demand specially in rainwater harvesting. There are many sub-projects under each water catchment level project.

Project in 2 VDC's in Salyan. The activity will be undertaken together with two local NGOs: - Mid West Youth Unification Centre (MYUC Nepal) and People’s Awareness for Rural Development Centre (PARD Nepal).
RWHs and biogas together with drip irrigation will be the interventions in the project, indigenous knowledge will be exercised in developing and modifying improvements of these technologies

Rain water harvesting program will be implemented with focus on gender and social equity. Users group with 33% women and marginal group representation will be encouraged to empower women in development program. For ascertaining economic benefits income generation opportunities will be explored; sustainability of the systems will be assured with the provision f necessary trainings of the users and local service providers.

The project will support selected poor communities of those catchment areas of Salyan district to provide safe drinking water service through rainwater harvesting, small scale gravity flow schemes & spring source conservation and infrastructure improvements, ground water recharge for mid hill source, rainwater and waste water harvesting for irrigation, environmental sanitation and to promote good and sustain hygiene practice. The intervention targets the poorest and most vulnerable people.
